meanings.definition: Leading or coming before in time or order.
meanings.sent1: The forerunning car set the pace for the rest of the race.
meanings.sent2: The forerunning storm clouds signaled the approaching bad weather.
meanings.sent3: The forerunning alarm clock decided to wake up the whole house extra early.
meanings.sent4: The forerunning sun peeked over the horizon, painting the sky in hues of pink and orange.
meanings.sent5: The forerunning student finished the test first, setting a high standard for the others.

meanings.definition: Serving as a precursor or indication of something to come.
meanings.sent1: The forerunning symptoms of a cold made her reach for the tissues.
meanings.sent2: The forerunning cracks in the wall hinted at a larger structural issue.
meanings.sent3: The forerunning squirrel gathering nuts seemed to be preparing for a long winter.
meanings.sent4: The forerunning stars twinkled in the night sky, foreshadowing a magical evening.
meanings.sent5: The forerunning smell of freshly baked cookies wafted through the house, promising a delicious treat.
